oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Landau level spin diode in a GaAs two dimensional hole system
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KLOCHAN, O
HAMILTON, AR
DAS GUPTA, K
SFIGAKIS, F
BEERE, HE
RITCHIE, DA
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: DYNAMIC NUCLEAR-POLARIZATION
QUANTUM POINT CONTACTS
ELECTRON-GAS
EDGE
DOTS
two-dimensional hole system
Landau level spin diode
hole-nuclear spin coupling
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We have fabricated and characterized a Landau level spin diode in a GaAs two-dimensional hole system. We used the spin diode to probe the hyperfine coupling between hole and nuclear spins and found no detectable net nuclear spin polarization, indicating that hole-nuclear spin flip-flop processes are suppressed by at least factor of 50 compared to GaAs electron systems.
